column5: Bottom 3 teams in the league are 1) Edmonton  2) Carolina  3) Toronto  What do their coaches have in common?  Pat Quinn Paul Maurice Ron Wilson  All leaf coaches  Coincidence?????

In the history of the maple leafs only one coach has ever won the Jack Adams trophy for coach of the year. That was Pat Burns in 1993. The maple leafs have NEVER had a Norris Trophy winner for best defenceman. The last maple leafs Vezina Trophy winner for best goalie was in 1965 Bower/Sawchuk.  Coaching, defence and goaltending. These are the things championships are built on.
Smore trivia......  I wonder how many OFNers, apart from me, have actually seen   the Toronto Maple Leafs  win the Stanley Cup
Well Lew, I was 5 years old when they last won the cup and no, I can't remember it at all! It's pretty sad actually. HH
We both did, Lew. Just consider it one of those moments neither one of us will ever get back. Ever.

I was born 1950, so I remember watching them with my dad when in high school. Every Saturday night with that familiar Imperial Oil/ Esso guy as the majour sponsor. On Wednesdays the game was usually in the second period by the time the network switched to it, 9 PM. if I remember right, of course it was B&W.
Don't feel left out, the Leafs have been negative since '67 too

gonna be awhile before we see a parade in TO other than the pride one...hey dave..i was born in 53 and remember..the esso guy was MURRAY WESTGATE and the interviews were done by WARD CORNELL(i think)...happy motoring..
to hell with leaf talk who remembers the first canada/ussr hockey games  oh and I saw the leafs win
